title: 112_hr6659
content: The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends the Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for certain cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends the Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for certain cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Economic development extension bonds issued within a specific timeframe are treated as qualified bonds with increased benefits and interest inclusion in gross income. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for certain cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Specified bonds are obligations where interest would be excludable from gross income under section 103. Rules similar to section 54AA(d)(2) apply, and section 148 does not apply if excess funds are used for qualified purposes. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specified cities with certain criteria. Qualified purposes include economic development and refinancing of city debt. A specified city is defined by high unemployment and significant job loss. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specified cities meeting specific criteria, including a population loss of at least 20% between 2000 and 2010. The maximum bond amount allocated to each city is based on its population proportion to the total population of all specified cities. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specified cities meeting specific criteria, including a population loss of at least 20% between 2000 and 2010. The table of sections for part III of subchapter Y of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by adding a new item. Extension of recovery zone economic development bonds for certain cities, effective for obligations issued after the enactment of this Act.
